message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "The study uses panel data from the World Bank Enterprise Surveys conducted between 2006 and 2020 in selected South Asian countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "This research paper derives insights from the Global Findex database, World Bank's high-quality, individual-level financial inclusion database.", "dataset": ["Global Findex database"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "Using the India Human Development Survey (IHDS) for 2011-12 and 2015-16, we analyse trends and patterns of intergenerational educational attainment in India by caste, gender, and poverty status.", "dataset": ["India Human Development Survey (IHDS)"], "topic": ["Education", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "The analysis utilises the Living Standards Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (LSMS-ISA) data sets collected in Malawi, Uganda, Tanzania, and Ethiopia.", "dataset": ["Living Standards Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (LSMS-ISA)"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "We used publicly available datasets including Europeana, Shared Canvas, and IIIF to build a custom dataset of digitized manuscripts and develop models for their automatic classification.", "dataset": ["Europeana", "Shared Canvas", "IIIF"], "topic": ["Digital Development"]}, {"sentence": "This article combines household survey data from the Fourth Integrated Household Survey of the Armed Forces of Liberia with spatial data on newly-discovered rubber farm locations obtained from satellite imagery.", "dataset": ["Fourth Integrated Household Survey of the Armed Forces of Liberia"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Spatial Analysis"]}, {"sentence": "We use data from the Carbonn Climate Registry database to investigate municipal climate change mitigation actions focused on transport, and to identify the most effective strategies for achieving emission reduction targets.", "dataset": ["Carbonn Climate Registry database"], "topic": ["Transport", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "Using publicly available data on conflict minerals supply chains from the International Tin Supply Chain Initiative, we study the effectiveness of interventions designed to eliminate conflict minerals from global supply chains while promoting economic development in conflict-affected regions.", "dataset": ["International Tin Supply Chain Initiative"], "topic": ["Extractive Industries", "Fragility, Conflict, and Violence"]}, {"sentence": "The analysis employs a range of data sets that cover multiple infrastructure sectors: energy, water and sanitation, transportation, ICT, health and education, justice and security, and urban planning.", "dataset": ["multiple infrastructure sectors"], "topic": ["Infrastructure"]}, {"sentence": "To examine how immigration affects native employment, this research utilises matched employer-employee data from Germany's Integrated Employment Biographies, supplemented by county-level data on immigrant populations.", "dataset": ["Germany's Integrated Employment Biographies"], "topic": ["Migration", "Jobs & Development"]}]
